ai.question: At which layer of the OSI model do wireless access points operate?
Which two steps are required for a wireless client to associate with an access point? (Choose two.)
Which three WLAN client authentication types require a preprogrammed network key to be set on the client? (Choose three.)

choice.text: SHARED with data encryption algorithm WEP
WPA with data encryption algorithm TKIP
WPA-PSK with data encryption algorithm TKIP
WPA2 with data encryption algorithm AES
WPA2-PSK with data encryption algorithm AES

ai.question: Which two items contribute to the security of a WLAN? (Choose two.)
Which term is used for products that are tested to be interoperable in both PSK and 802.1X/Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) operation for authentication?
To help ensure a secure wireless network, most enterprise networks should follow which IEEE standard?
Refer to the exhibit. Which method of network authentication provides the highest level of security?
Which two combinations of 802.11b RF channels would allow two wireless APs to operate simultaneously in the same room with no channel overlap? (Choose two.)
Why do cordless devices, such as cordless telephones, sometimes interfere with wireless access points?

choice.text: These devices operate at similar frequencies.
These devices operate at the same frequencies and have higher RF power settings.
These devices flood the entire frequency spectrum with low power noise, which may cause loss of signal for wireless devices trying to connect with an access point.
The signal from the cordless device is non-polarized and combines with the access point polarized signal, thus reducing overall signal strength.

ai.question: Refer to the exhibit. What is the recommended overlap between the two wireless access points to provide proper connectivity for users?

ai.question: Which WLAN client settings would be reviewed to resolve encryption problems with the access point?

choice.text: channel selection for ad hoc networks
